subject: Investing
title: Types of Risk Every Investor Faces
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Types of Risk Every Investor Faces.

hook.text: In 2008, credit risk, market risk, and liquidity risk all struck at onceâ€”a perfect storm.

buildup.text: Market risk affects all assets. Credit risk hits bonds if a borrower defaults. Liquidity risk traps cash.

discovery.text: Currency risk, inflation risk, and interest-rate risk add more layers for global and bond investors.

twist.text: Risks that seem independent often become correlated in a crisis, when diversification helps least.

climax.text: Naming each risk is the first step to measuring and managing it in your portfolio.

punchline.text: You can't manage what you can't name. Label your risks first.

quiz.question: Which risk relates to a borrower failing to repay?
